techmeme.title: Indian insurance firm Star Health says it suffered a "malicious cyberattack", about two weeks after hackers put 31M customers' alleged personal data on Telegram (Jagmeet Singh/TechCrunch)
Grabango, which provided cashierless checkout tech and raised just over $73M, shuts down after failing to secure enough funding to continue its services (CNBC)
The US GSA says Login.gov is opening up its face recognition capabilities, which compare a live selfie with the photo on a photo ID, to government agencies (Natalie Alms/Nextgov/FCW)
Florida-based data broker National Public Data files for bankruptcy, admitting an August 2024 leak of SSNs may impact "hundreds of millions" of people (Michael Kan/PCMag)
A threat actor hacked the Internet Archive and stole a user authentication database with 31M unique records; a DDoS attack took the site offline on Wednesday (Lawrence Abrams/BleepingComputer)
